topic.title: Create a Cluster with the cf-mgmt Tool

body.p: Not all cluster management and creation features are available through the Horizon console. The cf-mgmt tool can take direct input or leverage a bootstrap file to simplify cluster creation and expansion.
The first example creates a micro-cloud where all roles are installed on one VM. This example does not require installing the Helion Development Platform; it runs in the Helion Public Cloud.
The second example creates a cluster with one core node and two DEAs and then adds the MySQL service.

The third example demonstrates how to grow a cluster once it has been created. To minimize the risk of error, avoid creating huge clusters all at once. Best practice is to create a core and then expand it.

section.note: For convenience, copy the code blocks and paste them into a text editor. You can edit them there and then copy and paste back into the cf-mgmt tool as necessary.
You may also want to refer to the full cf-mgmt tool command reference documentation.
